definition: unable to move a single step (idiom)/to be in an (extremely) difficult situation
a unit of length/inch/thumb
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: Three college girls driving in a hard-driving rainstorm crash their car.
sentences.chinese: 三个女学生在暴风雨中行驶，几乎寸步难行。

sentences.english: The your world has not been difficult, I am stranded in-situ, no matter what recollection agglutination.
sentences.chinese: 没有你世界寸步难行，我困在原地任回忆凝集。

sentences.english: Others make it to the sand bank in the middle but from there they are unable to move.
sentences.chinese: 还有一些陷在了中间的沙滩上，寸步难行。

sentences.english: The your world has not been difficult, I was stranded in-situ, no matter what recollection agglutination.
sentences.chinese: 没有你世界寸步难行，我困在原地任回忆凝集。

sentences.english: The chair was stuck to her and she could hardly walk.
sentences.chinese: 可是一把椅子拦住了她的路，让她寸步难行。

sentences.english: Tip Two:Do Show Your ID Card All The Time.
sentences.chinese: 随时随地出示身份证明，否则寸步难行。

sentences.english: I got caught in the rush-hour traffic.
sentences.chinese: 我遇上了高峰时间的车辆，寸步难行。

sentences.english: 'Money talks, and people walk, ' he said.
sentences.chinese: 他说，有钱能使鬼推磨，没钱则寸步难行。

sentences.english: She was seriously burned on her face, she could not walk a step without a stick!
sentences.chinese: 她脸部严重烧伤，没有拐杖则寸步难行。

sentences.english: Nathan:China, the only country to fight the US to a stand still in the Korea.
sentences.chinese: 中国，唯一打得美国在朝鲜寸步难行的国家。

definition: see 寸步難行|寸步难行[cun4 bu4 nan2 xing2]
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
nowhere to hide
nowhere to go/at the end of one's tether
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
lit. there is no road to the sky, nor door into the earth (idiom)/fig. to be at the end of one's rope/to be trapped in a hopeless situation
pinyin: shang4 tian1 wu2 lu4 , ru4 di4 wu2 men2

definition: isolated and without help
to have difficulty walking (idiom)/to walk with difficulty
to look up and see no-one familiar (idiom); not having anyone to rely on/without a friend in the world
to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
danger lurks on every side (idiom)
(idiom) dead end/road to ruin
impossible to make a living
to suffer unspeakable misery/indescribably painful/hellish
